name: ponderable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
able to be guessed or calculated by thinking: Professional philosophers consider these questions to be eminently ponderable. Her book claims to present a ponderable argument for the existence of God.
able to be weighed: Matter consists of ponderable stuff. He wrote a paper concerning the motion of ponderable objects.
More examplesFewer examplesSome of the mysteries that have puzzled thinkers for centuries are now becoming ponderable.I am sure that the reason for this is ponderable, but I don't know the answer.This substance really does exist, although it is not visible or ponderable.
